Title.name: Cornish Hens Stuffed with Wild Rice and Pistachios

Recipe.Description: Cornish hens, stuffed with wild rice and pistachios, roasted to a deep golden brown. Worth the preparation it takes.

Prerequisites.Prerequisite: Remove giblets and necks (when present), cut wing tips from birds and roast all these bits in 350 degree oven until lightly browned.
Prepare Wild Rice Stuffing with the pistachios, and chopped giblets.

Method.Step: Spoon the stuffing into each bird, but don't pack it in tight. Seal the stuffing in the birds (get some curved upholstery needles from Walmart and some kite string or twine) by stitching the skin closed.

Place hens, breast up, on a rack over a shallow roasting pan. (Use one of the grates from your gas grill, cake cooler rack, etc.). Put them in the over, reduce heat to 375 and bake for 45 minutes, until golden brown and internal temperature (breast) reaches 170 degrees.

Remove from oven, let stand to rest lightly covered with foil or in microwave for 15 minutes to cool sufficiently so that internal steam can convert back to liquid and be reabsorbed by the meat and be nice and juicy and tasty at the table -unless you like dried-out and mealy poultry.
Meanwhile...
Remove fat from drippings in the bottom of roasting pan, place pan on stove over high heat and deglaze with wine.
Add minced shallots and parsley, lower heat to fast simmer until sauce is reduced by half. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Just prior to serving, swirl a tbsp of butter through the sauce.

Using a large, very sharp knife, split each hen lengthwise by slicing down directly over the breastbone. This is best done at the table so your guests can get the immediate initial whiff of the stuffing and truffle essence, don't waste that aroma to your stove's exhaust hood! Puddle a bit of sauce onto the plate, place the hen on the sauce and garnish with sprig of fresh sage.
Serve with Garlic Mashed Potatoes and Prosciutto Wrapped Asparagus.
